title: What the Sunglasses Emoji ğŸ˜ Means on Snapchat: Friendship Emojis Explained

steps.title: The ğŸ˜ emoji next to someoneâ€™s name means you have a mutual Best Friend with that person.
steps.content: The ğŸ˜ emoji next to someoneâ€™s name means you have a mutual Best Friend with that person. On Snapchat, a Best Friend is someone you send a lot of snaps to but isnâ€™t your #1 Best Friend (or Bestie, as Snapchat calls it). When you see the ğŸ˜ emoji next to a Snapchatterâ€™s name, it means one of your Best Friends is also one of their Best Friends. [1] X Research source Why is it important? Essentially, the ğŸ˜ emoji is an easy, visual way to show that you and one of your contacts send a lot of snaps to the same person. This lets you see how your social circles are interconnected and could encourage you to snap this person more often, too!

steps.title: You may see a string of emojis next to your friend's name including ğŸ˜.
steps.content: You may see a string of emojis next to your friend's name including ğŸ˜. Depending on how often you snap someone and who else you (and your Snapchat friends) interact with the most, you might end up with multiple emojis that describe your relationship. Some common ones people see include: ğŸ˜ğŸ’›: This person is your Bestie or #1 Best Friend (ğŸ’›) and you have a mutual Best Friend (ğŸ˜) that you both send lots of snaps to. ğŸ˜ğŸ˜Š: This person is one of your Best Friends (ğŸ˜Š) and you have another mutual Best Friend (ğŸ˜) that you both snap a lot. ğŸ˜¬ğŸ˜: You and this person share a Bestie (ğŸ˜¬) and you also have another Best Friend in common (thereâ€™s a good chance you two run in the same circles IRL).

steps.title: Can my Snapchat friend see the ğŸ˜ emoji by their name?
steps.content: Can my Snapchat friend see the ğŸ˜ emoji by their name? No, only you can see the friendship emojis in your contacts since theyâ€™re based on your Snapchat relationship with others. [2] X Research source You also cannot see the friendship emoji next to your name in someone else's Snapchat contacts.

steps.title: Can you see who your mutual Best Friend is?
steps.content: Can you see who your mutual Best Friend is? No, you canâ€™t see that information in the Snapchat app. However, you can do some sleuthing to find outâ€”if youâ€™re determined to know, youâ€™ll have to ask who your ğŸ˜â€™s friendâ€™s Best Friends are and compare that list to your own Best Friends. Anyone who overlaps could be your mutual!

steps.title: Will the ğŸ˜ go away if you use Snapchat less?
steps.content: Will the ğŸ˜ go away if you use Snapchat less? Yes, your friendship emojis can change (or even disappear) based on you and your friendsâ€™ Snapchat usage. For example, the ğŸ˜ emoji may disappear if either you or your friend stop snapping your mutual Best Friend as often. Another easy example is the Snapstreak emoji (ğŸ”¥)â€”if you and your friend donâ€™t snap each other every day, your fire emoji will vanish.

steps.title: What does ğŸ˜ mean outside of Snapchat?
steps.content: What does ğŸ˜ mean outside of Snapchat? Over text and on other social media platforms, the ğŸ˜ emoji represents all things â€œcoolâ€ and conveys a confident attitude (and maybe a bit of cockiness, too). In a literal sense, it could also mean that itâ€™s just so bright outside that you need to wear sunglasses. [3] X Research source

steps.content: Baby face ğŸ‘¶: New friends The ğŸ‘¶ emoji next to a Snapchatterâ€™s name means you just became friends with this person. Let the snapping commence! As you snap more, your friendship emoji will change to reflect your relationship. [4] X Research source

steps.content: Smiling face ğŸ˜Š: Best Friends (BFs) This person is one of your top friends on Snapchat, and you send them a lot of snaps! However, theyâ€™re not quite your #1 Best Friend. [5] X Research source

steps.content: Grimacing face ğŸ˜¬: Mutual Besties Your Bestie (or #1 Best Friend) is also this personâ€™s Bestie. This means you send the most snaps to the same person they do. [6] X Research source No need for jealousy, thoughâ€”thereâ€™s plenty of room for everyone to snap to their heartâ€™s content!

steps.content: Smirking face ğŸ˜: One-sided friendship The ğŸ˜ face next to someoneâ€™s name means that you are one of their Best Friends, but they are not one of yours. AKA, they snap you a lot but you donâ€™t send them very many snaps or messages. [7] X Research source

steps.content: Yellow heart ğŸ’›: Besties Congrats! You and this Snapchatter are each otherâ€™s #1 Best Friend. This means you send the most snaps to this person, and they send the most snaps to you. [8] X Research source

steps.content: Red heart â¤ï¸: BFFs (Best Friends Forever) This friendship emoji is a step up from the yellow heart. It means you and your friend have been Besties for 2 weeks in a row. What a commitment! [9] X Research source

steps.content: Pink hearts ğŸ’•: Super BFFs OK, now things are getting serious. This emoji means youâ€™ve been each otherâ€™s Besties for 2 whole months straight! [10] X Research source Keep this up and youâ€™ll be best friends for life!

steps.title: Fire ğŸ”¥: Snapstreak
steps.content: Fire ğŸ”¥: Snapstreak On Snapchat, a streak is when you and a friend snap each other at least once every day consecutively. The fire emoji appears next to their name when this happens and stays there as an encouraging reminder to keep up the streak! [11] X Research source

steps.content: 100 ğŸ’¯: 100-Day Snapstreak Whoa! You and this Snapchatter have kept up your streak for 100 consecutive days. ğŸ˜® Thatâ€™s some intense friendship right there. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Hourglass âŒ›: Snapstreak ending soon
steps.content: Hourglass âŒ›: Snapstreak ending soon Uh oh! Your Snapstreak is about to run out. When you see this emoji, you and your friend have 24 hours to send each other a snap to save your streak. Otherwise, youâ€™ll be starting over from scratch! [13] X Research source Remember, snaps or chats sent in groups with this person donâ€™t count! Snap them individually to keep the streak alive.

steps.title: Birthday cake ğŸ‚: Friendâ€™s birthday
steps.content: Birthday cake ğŸ‚: Friendâ€™s birthday When this emoji pops up next to someoneâ€™s name, itâ€™s their birthday! Send them a friendly birthday message or a funny snap to give them a laugh and wish them well on their special day. [14] X Research source A Snapchatterâ€™s birthday is based on what they entered when they created their account, so itâ€™s possible you might see a ğŸ‚ when itâ€™s not their actual birthday if they entered a different date. You may also see a purple zodiac sign emoji in your friendâ€™s profile beneath their user name corresponding to their birthday (if they entered it): [15] X Research source â™ˆ: Aries (March 21â€“April 20) â™‰: Taurus (April 21â€“May 21) â™Š: Gemini (May 22â€“June 21) â™‹: Cancer (June 22â€“July 22) â™Œ: Leo (July 23â€“August 22) â™: Virgo (August 23â€“September 23) â™: Libra (September 24â€“October 23) â™: Scorpius (October 24â€“November 22) â™: Sagittarius (November 23â€“December 21) â™‘: Capricorn (December 22â€“January 20) â™’: Aquarius (January 21â€“February 19) â™“: Pisces (February 20â€“March 20)

steps.content: Gold star ğŸŒŸ: Someone has replayed this personâ€™s snaps within the last 24 hours. Pay attention next time they send you somethingâ€”apparently, itâ€™s interesting enough to watch again and again! [16] X Research source

steps.title: Gold sparkles âœ¨: Youâ€™re in a group together
steps.content: Gold sparkles âœ¨: Youâ€™re in a group together This newer addition to the friendship emojis means you and this person are in the same group chat on Snapchat. [17] X Research source In groups, you can send messages and snaps to multiple people at once for everyone in that group to see (rather than sending separate snaps to multiple people).

steps.title: Peace sign âœŒ: Favorite group
steps.content: Peace sign âœŒ: Favorite group This emoji appears next to the Snapchat group you send the most chats and snaps to. Itâ€™s an easy way to figure out which groups you spend the most time engaging with. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Friendship emojis are based on how often you interact with someone.
steps.content: Friendship emojis are based on how often you interact with someone. Snapchatâ€™s emoji system is a unique and fun way to keep track of who youâ€™re snapping the most (and who snaps you the most in return), as well as which friends are snapping each other. This way, you can see how your social circles are intertwined and find new mutuals with your friends. [19] X Research source Frequency is the biggest determining factor for which emoji appears, but some other factors include how long youâ€™ve been friends and other Snapchatters you interact with. The friendship emojis are only visible to you, allowing you to manage your friends privately. Fun fact: When Snapchat first launched, everyone had 3 Best Friends that were publicly displayed on their profile. However, the system was changed to the current friendship emojis after users expressed privacy concerns.

steps.title: On iOS
steps.content: On iOS The friendship emojis above are Snapchatâ€™s defaults, but you can change them however you like! Follow these steps to customize how you see your friends: Open Snapchat and tap your profile icon in the top left corner. [20] X Research source Tap the gear icon in the top right corner to open Settings. Scroll down to â€œAdditional Servicesâ€ and tap â€œManage.â€ Tap â€œFriend Emojisâ€ to pull up the list of friend emojis, then tap a specific emoji to edit it.

steps.title: On Android
steps.content: On Android The steps for editing your friendship emojis on Android are a bit simpler than for iOS: [21] X Research source Open Snapchat and tap your profile icon in the top left corner of the screen. Tap the gear icon in the top right corner to open Settings. Scroll down and tap â€œCustomize Emojis.â€ Tap on a friendship emoji to change it.
